children.string: Uses [[Discourse Graph]] to break down knowledge into discrete parts
Uses [[Query Builder]] to query specific pieces of knowledge based on their relationships
Uses [[Discourse Graph]], [[Query Builder]] and [[Issues Tracking]] to **assign**, **track**, and **query** ^^Issues^^ by project, lab member, and priority
Follow the [[Tutorial/Installing Plugins]] first to get everything in order
Then browse the [[Tutorial/Roam Research]] to learn about networked notebooks
Take the [[Tutorial/Discourse Graph]] to get up to speed on adding semantic structure your notes
{{[[TODO]]}} Follow that up with the [[Convention/Issues Tracking]] to familiarize yourself with ...
When you have time, take a look at the more advanced [[Tutorial/Query Builder]] to see what is possible and available to you
{{[[TODO]]}} add **PROFILE** to let everyone else know how weird you __really__ are
[[Convention/Sync Meetings]] to keep on track with each other
Evidence Statement ((single sentence that can be interpreted in a standalone way))
Evidence Description ((free-form paragraph, against should be interpretable on its own (optional) ))
Snippets ((from the paper that can be summarized into the evidence description, each with page it‚Äôs from (optional) ))
Grounding Context ((What extra info puts this observation in context?))
How central is this evidence to the claim at hand?
Free Course: [Roam in Context by Cortex Futura](https://learn.cortexfutura.com/p/roam-in-context)
The very basics of Roam's main features, all taught within the context of 7 different use cases.
Copy this to to a page to test!

{{[[DONE]]}} update [[Tutorial/zoteroRoam]] with source when bugfix 0.7.6 is pushed
To cite a particular paper, first see if it has been imported to the graph.
Importing a Paper to the graph
Load the zoteroRoam extension, which is the little book üìñ button at the top right of the screen
this opens a direct link to our Zotero Library of papers
After selecting the paper you can see if it has been imported to the graph already or not
To create the page and import the data click on `Import metadata`
Then click on `Go to Roam page`
This page contains lots of useful information about the paper
Finally, **to cite the paper**, you can hyperlink to the page by enclosing the title of the page within two square brackets
Steps to setup individual plugins required for Discourse Graph
Click on the red "Yes, I know what I'm doing button."
Go here, or open in the sidebar: ((aluwukGuy))
Plugins are activated per user, not for the graph as a whole
So you can set up any plugins you like to edit your experience as you choose
for example, I like to include scrollbars üòÅ via [Roam Depot](((Qtsw_xC_t)))
Setting up plugins via RoamDepot ((RoamDepot is the official app store for Roam))
To set up or "active" the plugins for the first time, navigate to the following links and click on the red "Yes, I know what I'm doing button."
You should only have to do this one time for each plugin.  The next time you come back to the graph, it should be yellow, like this:
Setting up plugins via [[roam/js]] ((note, this is temporary, both Discourse Graph and zoteroRoam are moving to Roam Depot))
Plugin for Roam for **importing data from Zotero to Roam based on a citekey**.
Fill in ID and API Key
Right Click on Icon, Click on Settings
Add the `@` symbol to the **trigger** field
type `;;` to pull up any block with `#roam/template` on the same line
Think of a piece of research you've read.
List a `Question` posed by the research, a `Claim` they made, and the piece of `Evidence` that supports the `Claim`
**Below, write a Question, Claim, and Evidence**
**Below, write a Question, Claim, and Evidence**
Question: Do Pineapples belong on pizza?
Claim: Anything tasty belongs on pizza
Evidence: 100 people surveyed said pineapples are tasty
**Below, write a Question, Claim, and Evidence**
Question: [[[[QUE]] - What speed do immune cells crawl?]]
Claim: [[[[CLM]] - Cells crawl 50 nm per second]]
Evidence:[[[[EVD]] - 95 out of 100 cells crawled faster than 50 nm per second shown by microscopy -]]
**Below, write a Question, Claim, and Evidence**
You can open that link in the sidebar by `Shift-Click`
then click on the red "Yes, I know what I'm doing button."
Then it should look like this
**Highlight** the text of your question, hit `\`, select `Question`
**Drag** the `Claim` and the `Evidence` text into the `Question` page, and use `\` to turn each into pages
Go to the `Evidence` page, and check the `Discourse Context` at the bottom of the page!
avatar:: ((<(optional) <use /upload to choose a picture from your computer>))
location:: ((<(optional) Add your city, state, country>))

title: [[QUE]] - What speed do immune cells crawl?

children.string: The purpose of this convention is to create a bit more structure in the communication within the graph.
This should give more assurance to everyone that their messages will be received as well as allow easier processing for messages over time.
To **send a message to another member**, the current process for in graph messaging is as follows:
Make it a `TODO` ((You can do with via `CTRL`/`CMD` + `Enter` or by typing `{{[[TODO]]}}`))
`{{[[TODO]]}} [[+Matt Akamatsu]] This is my message for Matt`
here you can check off the `[[TODO]]` to **clear** the message from the list as `[[DONE]]`
To **view your messages**, go to your [Inbox]([[üì© Inboxes]])
To **reply to messages**, simply nest reply under the original message after you have checked it to `[[DONE]]`
You can do directly in the inbox
Create a `Sync Meeting/Party Names` page for a recurring meeting between parties
eg. `[[Sync Meetings/John Doe and Jane McPerson]]`
You can use this page as an `inbox` to store notes, updates, references, etc., until the next scheduled meeting
This page will also as a hub linking all past and future meetings
Create a new `block` for each new meeting once the meeting is scheduled
Name the block with the date of the next meeting
Use the `[[Convention/Sync Meetings]] #roam/templates` template on the meeting block
Transfer the `inbox` notes to from the **Parent Sync Page** to the new **Meeting Block**
^^Create custom and programmable templates from within Roam!^^
